SG.overview: Singapore has established comprehensive regulations for tokenization through the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). The Payment Services Act regulates digital payment tokens, while securities tokens fall under the Securities and Futures Act.

regulations.title: Payment Services Act (PSA)
regulations.description: Governs digital payment token services including exchanges and wallet providers

regulations.title: Securities and Futures Act (SFA)
regulations.description: Applies to tokens that constitute securities or derivatives

regulations.title: MAS Guidelines on Digital Tokens
regulations.description: Provides guidance on the application of securities laws to token offerings

requirements: License required for operating digital payment token services
AML/CFT compliance mandatory
Technology risk management standards must be met
Consumer protection measures required

US.overview: The United States has a complex regulatory framework for tokenization involving multiple agencies. The SEC regulates security tokens, while the CFTC oversees certain digital commodities. State-level regulations also apply.

regulations.title: Securities Act of 1933
regulations.description: Security tokens must comply with registration or exemption requirements

regulations.title: Howey Test
regulations.description: Determines whether a token qualifies as a security

requirements: SEC registration or exemption for security tokens
State money transmitter licenses may be required
AML/KYC compliance under Bank Secrecy Act
CFTC oversight for certain tokens

GB.overview: The United Kingdom regulates tokenization through the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA). Security tokens are regulated as specified investments, while certain crypto assets fall under e-money or payment services regulations.

regulations.title: Financial Services and Markets Act 2000
regulations.description: Primary legislation governing financial services including security tokens

regulations.title: Money Laundering Regulations 2017
regulations.description: Applies to cryptoasset exchange providers and custodian wallet providers

requirements: FCA authorization required for security token activities
Registration for cryptoasset businesses
AML/CTF compliance mandatory
Consumer protection and disclosure requirements

CH.overview: Switzerland, particularly through FINMA, has developed a progressive and clear regulatory framework for tokenization. The country distinguishes between payment tokens, utility tokens, and asset tokens.

regulations.title: DLT Act
regulations.description: Blockchain and DLT-specific framework introduced in 2021

regulations.title: FINMA ICO Guidelines
regulations.description: Classification framework for tokens and regulatory treatment

requirements: License requirements depend on token classification
AML compliance for financial intermediaries
Prospectus requirements for asset tokens
Banking license may be required for certain activities

AE.overview: The United Arab Emirates has established a progressive regulatory framework for tokenization, with Dubai's Virtual Assets Regulatory Authority (VARA) leading the way. Dubai has created a comprehensive regulatory regime for virtual assets including tokens, while the federal UAE government has also issued regulations through the Securities and Commodities Authority (SCA).

regulations.title: Dubai Virtual Assets Regulation Law (Law No. 4 of 2022)
regulations.description: Establishes VARA as the regulatory authority for virtual assets in Dubai and provides the framework for licensing and regulation

regulations.title: VARA Virtual Assets and Related Activities Regulations 2023
regulations.description: Comprehensive regulations covering licensing, conduct, compliance, and operational requirements for virtual asset service providers

regulations.title: VARA Marketing Regulations 2023
regulations.description: Governs marketing and promotion of virtual assets and related services in Dubai

regulations.title: Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022
regulations.description: Federal law regulating virtual assets at the UAE national level through the Securities and Commodities Authority

regulations.title: VARA Token Services Regulations
regulations.description: Specific regulations for token issuance, custody, and trading services

requirements: VARA license required for operating virtual asset activities in Dubai
Minimum capital requirements varying by license type
Comprehensive AML/CFT compliance programs mandatory
Cybersecurity and data protection measures required
Token issuers must provide detailed disclosure documents
Custody of virtual assets must meet VARA standards
Market abuse and insider trading prohibitions enforced
Consumer protection and fair treatment obligations
authorities: Securities and Commodities Authority (SCA) - Federal UAE
Dubai Financial Services Authority (DFSA) - Dubai International Financial Centre
